channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Colvestone Crecent School is a landfilled now, 17th September
item.description:
This school was so nice; now it looks disgusting, full of bottles, food, and littering of any type. People drink near where I shoot the pictures, and after they throw the bottles and any kind of rubbish in the school. Anyway, could you do something?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Colvestone Crescent, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 17th September
item.description:
In thomes lane open car park car park there is a bed mattress black bags other stuff like card broad it was put there there wensday morning it come from the flats I was walking that way to work

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thomas Lane, Ladywell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding, 17th September
item.description:
Flat number 11 has flooded my flat no 1 and the flat above no 6 THREE times in the last 3 months. I have now made an insurance claim and look to the Council to stop this happening again. It's causing damage to my flat!
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Whiston Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Near church alleyway, 17th September
item.description:
I reported last wk and you guys told me it will be done but nothing happening area stinks all the way people use this alleyway for school run in the morning and afternoon. No action taken it's been there more than one wk can you please do something Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whetstone Road, Kidbrooke, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish dumped behind our homes blocking right of way, 17th September
item.description:
The rubbish that has been dumped is blocking rights of way for 52, 54 & 56 Eynsford crescent which we have as per the freehold titles we have. These rights of way are required to be maintained by the council and this rubbish has been here a while even though others have reported this. Given the legal issues that could occur as a result of our rights of way being blocked and my elderly neighbours are unable to exit their garage/gate, please can someone come urgently to clear this

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Cottage Field Close, Albany Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet
